reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked The River Palace Hotel through Northwest World Vacations. The reservation came with a standard room... but having read on this site about how small the rooms were, we opted to pay the additional 50Euro per night for an upgraded (larger) room. It was a good decision.
reviews.title: Great Location - Worth the Extra $ for the Upgrade

likes.liked: — The location... right near the Piazza del Popolo and the Metro (Flamenia)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some key observations:
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Room and bathroom could have been a little bigger

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *The hotel is very clean and well maintained. There is a nice lounge off of the Reception area near the bar... the furntiure is modern (updated from what they have on their website at the moment).
reviews.title: Good things come in small packages! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: *The location is ideal - right near the Metro station and Piazza del Popolo.
reviews.title: Overpriced and disapointing

likes.disliked: — Tiny, overpriced and the cavalier attitude from staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: *The Hotel provides a continental breakfast in the morning, but it is much more than a standard continental and provides eggs, bacon and sausage as well as a full-line of pastries, yougurt, juice and fruit. We were very pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, ok, rooms are a little small but they are perfectly comfortable and more than adequate. We arrived at the hotel and asked if any "free" upgrades were available, we were greeted by warm smiles and upgraded free of charge to an executive room. The main bonus of this was the fact that someone took the trouble to come to our room every evening to pull the curtains for us and leave us a mini box of godiva choccies on our bed - yum!
reviews.title: Superfantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Staff couldn't be more helpful, giving us directions, restaurant recommendations, maps - nothing was too much trouble for these people.
reviews.title: Lovely 'little' hotel

likes.liked: — Very clean, comfortable and well decorated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is literally a minutes walk from the metro and if you are happy to use this to get around, you will save yourself a fair few euros. An example of this is when we left our coach from the hotel at Termni station, we immediately did the tourist thing and hailed a cab. This short journey to the hotel cost us 28 euros. The return journey to the same point via the metro cost us 2 euros!!! Be brave, its easy to use and much much cleaner than London underground.
reviews.title: A 4* Doll's House/Hamster Pen...

likes.disliked: — the size of the whole hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to find a down-side to this hotel then I would go for the room service. The food is great, but its pricey and, on-top of it already being pricey, you are charged an 8 euro supplement. I think this is pretty standard in most hotels but it seriously is the only downside I can think of.
reviews.title: Good hotel good position.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Enjoy your stay here, enjoy the great location, enjoy Rome!
reviews.title: quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was our first trip to Rome and we picked The River Palace because it seemed to have good reveiws on this site. We were not to be disappointed. What lovely rooms, we had a junior suite as there were three of us, they were on the small side but the decor was stunning and the bathroom out of this world. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The linen and towels were changed every day and there was a chocolate left on the pillows every evening. The loung and bar area were also stunning in their decor and it was a lovely place to unwind after a days sight seeing and shopping. Very good location, we ate just down the road in a small cafe were the food was fantastic and very reasonable. When we return to Rome we will be returning to The River Palace..
reviews.title: Loved the River Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in which helped justify the rather high price. Got a free upgrade on arrival to a superior room which was beautiful and spotlessly cleaned each day. The contents of a small marble quarry went into the bathroom which added to the luxury feel. The little box of 2 chocolates waiting on your bed each evening was a nice touch too.
reviews.title: Made a great holiday better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and spoke perfect English.
reviews.title: The only place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located at the North end of the historic city centre and most of the sights are within easy walking distance. Only the sights on the southern end (Colosseum, Forum) may require some assistance but then the metro is at the bottom of the street anyway!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new wife and I spent 5 days at the River Palace following our wedding, it having been recommended to us by friends. I booked their Suite Borghese, with a roof terrace, and in the few weeks before our trip emailed them via their website to let them know we were on our honey moon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read reviews of the River Palace prior to booking 5 nights for a recent trip to Rome. The location is great, and the hotel is clean and well appointed. The rooms, however, are really, really small. I read several reviews that mentioned room size and had brushed it off as feedback from people not used to European standard hotels. I have traveled extensively in Europe, and often hotels are much smaller than their N. American counterparts.
reviews.title: Small Rooms - No Really, Small Rooms
Highly recommend Hotel River Palace
reviews.text: That said, the rooms are tiny. Smallest hotel room I have ever seen. It was quite difficult to accomodate two people of normal size/stature. If you are tall and/or wide, forget it. There was barely room for suitcases/shopping bags, or anything else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elevator situation, previously mentioned, is also a bit of a drag as it requires two separate elevators to reach the upper floors of the hotel, and the 2nd of these can only accomodate two, maybe three, people at a time.
reviews.title: Best food and service we've had

likes.liked: — The staff and evening meal in the restaurant

reviews.title: river palace hotel
reviews.text: Based on experiences with other hotels in Rome, I would say look elsewhere unless you can't get a room. If you do end up here, know that other than the suites, your room will be very small, but will be clean and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the River Palace with my older parents and college age son. We all loved it! The location is great; good access to all in Rome, but quiet at night. Some of the rooms are on the small side, but nicely furnished. Convenient to Piazza De Popola,with many restaurants, and also a few neighborhood eateries for a late night dinner. The staff was fantastic-very helpful. The large buffet breakfast with great coffee/cappucino makes a great start to the day. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A really pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: We stayed here one night while awaiting our flight out of Rome. We had previously stayed in the Campo De Fiori section of Rome and were looking forward to getting the flavor of a different area of Rome. The room was fine, nothing special, just okay (although the carpet was a bit dirty in the hallway), the turndown service at night was a welcome surprise. Unfortunately, the hotel restaurant was closed and we were not impressed with the ones suggested, several blocks away, by the front desk. The area is a block from the Piazza in a 'bit' of a rundown/less desirable section. However, this is Rome and all you need to do is walk one or two blocks in a different direction for a different restaurant, store or view. The bar and piano player was a nice bonus while awaiting to go out to dinner and the breakfast was one of the most comprehensive in all 4 of the hotels we stayed in Italy. All in all, we think the prices paid were a bit high for an aging hotel that was just a bit off of a more desired location.
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Rome on our honeymoon and stayed at the River Palace for 4 nights.
reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel with Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a personal note from the hotel Manager with a box of chocolates waiting in our room which was an appreciative warmth after having traveled from Canada.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel and everything it provided.
reviews.title: Happy Days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved that you had access to free internet and in-house computers. Always pleasantly greeted by staff and the breakfast and food selections were delicious!
reviews.title: What a find
Great Location
reviews.text: River Palace Hotel has a great location within walking distance for Romes attractions. As previews reviews have said the rooms are not massive but this seems to be the same in City Hotels throughout Europe. We booked via Relaxabroad which had the Hotel on special offer so we were pleased with the price as Rome tends to be quite expensive. The breakfast was very good and we would recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Boyfriend and i stayed at this hotel at the beginning of November for a birthday suprise. I had e-mailed the hotel beforehand to check rates for an upgrade and was told i would be able to check when we arrived. We didnt need to, the room was great so kept it as it was and had a personal note from the manager wishing my boyfriend a happy birthday and a pleasent stay, Such a nice touch we thought.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The turning down of the bed covers every night and the weather forecast for the following day just added to the nice touches.
reviews.title: A lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, nothing was any trouble for them, location is brilliant, 1 min walk from the nearest Metro and short walking distances from all the major sights.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel, impressive restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if we ever go back we will definately stay here again
reviews.title: Comfortable and Clean Hotel

likes.disliked: — Size of room and the water was not very hot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the River Palace Hotel through Thomson City Breaks and was really impressed with the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Before making the booking I checked out the reviews on Trip Advisor and also booked a tour of the Vatican through Presto Tours which I can highly recommend.
reviews.title: Nice place, but not ethical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fine but the bathroom was on the small side, but how much of your holiday do you spend in the bathroom!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend break

likes.liked: — Very clean, ornate, and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and I liked the chocolate left on your pillow every evening, a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to start each day and finish each night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to family and friends, and I am sure I wil return in the future.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I have just come back from Rome staying at the River Palace. The hotel was excellent, beautiful decoration, spotlessly clean and a more than comfortable bed. On reading other reviews about small rooms, we found our room to be more than adequate (room 101 - facing the street). You could hear street noise, but what do you expect in the middle of Rome!! It all adds to the atmosphere. Location was excellent and we walked everywhere, Rome is so beautiful why spend your time on an underground and miss all the sights. You could easily walk to the Vatican in 20/25 minutes/Spanish Steps 10 minutes. At the Coliseum we picked up an English speaking guide who did a tour and would recommend doing this (email me if you need their name - I can't remember it, but have the brochure at home) as they also did a tour of Ancient Rome and the next day of the Vatican. It was very informative and we got a real insight into these places rather than walking around with a guide book. highly recommended. Food excellent - you can eat as expensive or cheap as you want. In the streets past Piazza Poppolo you can eat reasonably with 2 courses/beer for about 50 euros per couple. If you just want pizza and beer even cheaper. Overall Rome was excellent and would love to go back. We would definitely stay at the River Palace Hotel, excellent location, staff, rooms and breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel choice for Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: We came upon this hotel through an American Airlines program. Another hotel they'd recommended in another town was very large, so we were startled upon seeing the size of the room. Then we realized, yes it was small, but like a jewel box. It's decoration and furnishings were if not new, close to it, nicely designed and importantly to us, the matress comfortable and firm. We found that the closet could accommodate both our suitcases and a travel bag, our hanging clothes and its drawers held the rest, including a safe. By getting the suitcases out of the way, we were able to walk around the bed. The room contained a small corner desk with chair, two night stands and refrig/bar.
reviews.title: Jewel box

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was very good with meat, juice, eggs, fruit, rolls and breads, cheese, coffee, or cappuccino when ordered. The dining room staff was excellent. Because of its size, we had a short wait a couple mornings on couches with newspapers and magazines in the nearby lobby.The staff kept track of who was next. Overall, the hotel staff was excellent and helpful. The room and facilities were kept spotless.
reviews.title: Great place, fantastic location, helpfull staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband went for 5 days to Rome and we wanted to see everything! The location of the hotel is excellent, so it was possible to walk to almost every possible tourist attractions. The hotel is supposed to be in the very centre (and apparently it is) but the neighbourhood looks quite deserted and scary (we were told it was like that because it was August).
reviews.title: Don't let little mishaps upset you and you will be just fine ;)

likes.disliked: — Seeing Obama on CNN every time I wanted to watch some TV.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was aware of the size of the rooms in this hotel (thanx to TripAdvisor) but we were pleasantly surprised to get an upgraded room for free (103) which was enough for 2 people, suitcases and shopping bags!
reviews.title: Nice Littel Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is nice and willing to help you but they don’t speak English at all! I mean, they understand you but they cannot utter one understandable sentence. They believe they speak English but the strong Italian accent makes it completely incomprehensible for me. Anyways, I found it sweet rather than annoying  Besides, they knew it was our honeymoon and we expected to find a bottle of champagne next to the bed or at least a fruit platter … there was nothing though.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before going to River Palace I read ALL the reviews on TripAdvisor and now I agree with most of them. I was afraid of the elevator, but having the room on the first floor was a big relief for me. The air-con worked fine (except for the first night when there was a major power cut which left the hotel with no electricity for over one hour at 11pm! It was quite amusing for us to see all the guests in their pyjamas having good time in the hotel bar  The room was very clean and the service was excellent (chocolates on your pillows every evening will be very tempting …)
reviews.title: Little treasure in hot hot rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we did NOT find any good place in Rome with good pasta or pizza (SERIOUSLY), we were very happy to see a small restaurant right next to the hotel (Flaminia 9, as far as I remember, the same side of the street) where we would eat two delicious, generous portions with a JAR of wine for 25 euros!!! We highly recommend this place for dinner after a long day of walking.
reviews.title: A gem - highly recommended

likes.liked: — The decor of the room & ensuite
